criteria: Ability to accurately continue a number sequence from a given starting point.
Understanding of number patterns and relationships within the count sequence.
descriptions: Student is unable to count forward from a given number or struggles significantly with the counting sequence.
Student can count forward, but makes frequent errors in the number sequence or requires significant prompting.
Student can count forward from a given number with some errors or hesitations in the number sequence.
Student can count forward from a given number with generally accurate sequencing, but may have minor hesitations.
Student can fluently and accurately count forward from a given number with a strong understanding of the number sequence.
Student demonstrates mastery by fluently and accurately counting forward from any given number, including challenging or large numbers, showcasing a deep understanding of number sequence.
Student shows no understanding of number patterns or relationships when counting forward.
Student demonstrates minimal understanding of number patterns, struggling to identify relationships between numbers in the sequence.
Student recognizes some basic number patterns (e.g., even/odd) but struggles to apply this understanding to more complex sequences.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of number patterns and can identify relationships between numbers, but may not articulate them clearly.
Student clearly understands and articulates number patterns and relationships within the count sequence, using this knowledge to predict subsequent numbers.
Student exhibits a sophisticated understanding of number patterns, using this knowledge to count forward efficiently and accurately, even with unconventional sequences or large numbers.
